author: lavozdegalicia
title: A Coruña tendrá cabalgata de los Reyes Magos este domingo 5, pero cambia su recorrido por la lluvia y el viento
text:
Finalmente, las lluvias insistentes que se prevén para este domingo sí van a afectar a la cabalgata de los Reyes Magos . De momento, sus majestades de Oriente sí recorrerán A Coruña en la víspera de Reyes, aunque su ruta será diferente de la inicialmente prevista . El objetivo no es otro que evitar aquellas zonas más expuestas a las inclemencias del tiempo , especialmente, al viento. Por eso, las carrozas no circularán por calles tan céntricas y emblemáticas de este recorrido como Ramón y Cajal .
En su lugar, discurrirán por la calle Fernández Latorre, por lo que no se verán por delante de El Corte Inglés . « Ao seu paso polo barrio de Catro Camiños, discorrerá finalmente pola avenida Fernández Latorre en troques da rúa Ramón y Cajal. O resto do traxecto, con saída desde a rolda Camilo José Cela, en Monelos, e chegada a María Pita, manterase », remarcan desde el Ayuntamiento.
Esta medida « tómase co obxectivo de reforzar a seguridade da cidadanía en base ás condicións meteorolóxicas previstas esta fin de semana e, concretamente, o domingo », expone el concejal Gonzalo Castro . «O Concello segue pendente da evolución meteorolóxica nas próximas horas, mais cos datos dispoñibles a cabalgata manterase o día 5 cos horarios previstos e cumprindo con todos os requisitos de seguridade que segundo os criterios dos técnicos fan viable o evento », añaden desde María Pita.
Chegada das chuviasð°Ascenso das temperaturas
ð¹ #Galicia queda no dominio das borrascasð±ï¸
ð¹Chuvia mÃ¡is persistente no norte e oesteâï¸
ð¹Vento forte do surâ¬ï¸suroesteâï¸no litoral.
ð¡SÃ¡bado 4ðRefachos superiores aos 80 km/h a partir do mediodÃa no litoral e zonas altas. pic.twitter.com/Q15iBU28Qq
— MeteoGalicia (@MeteoGalicia) January 3, 2025 Domingo 5: una jornada «desapacible» que mejora por la tarde
El domingo por la mañana entra en A Coruña una borrasca profunda , indican desde Meteogalicia, que dejará una mañana «desapacible», valora Juan Taboada . Además de las lluvias persistentes, el frente también traerá vientos intensos, por lo que el meteorólogo valora de forma positiva la decisión del Ayuntamiento. «Es una buena idea cambiar el recorrido porque, aunque en la segunda mitad de la tarde el tiempo será algo más amable, puede haber rachas fuertes de viento aisladas», comenta Juan Taboada.
Como indica, lo peor de las lluvias y el viento este domingo será por la mañana aunque por la tarde entra un segundo frente en la ciudad , algo más débil, que dejará lluvias intermitentes. «Una cabalgata incluye muchos elementos que se pueden desprender, es algo delicado, es un mensaje muy bueno ser prudentes y no arriesgarse», opina Taboada.
El recorrido del día 5, con salida a las 18.00 horas
La comitiva partirá este domingo 5 desde el barrio de Monelos. Concretamente, « desde a rolda de Camilo José Cela, como xa fixo na última edición, ás 18.00 horas. O percorrido discorrerá pola avenida de Monelos e irá cara Alcalde Pérez Ardá e, xa a continuación, pola avenida Fernández Latorre e a Costa da Palloza, saíndo cara Linares Rivas e a praza de Ourense para emprender a marcha final polos Cantóns e a Marina, rematando como sempre na praza de María Pita, onde os reis saudarán aos nenos e nenas desde o balcón do pazo municipal », detalla el Concello.
Este año la cabalgata contará con 13 carrozas, seis municipales y siete de patrocinadores, seis trenes y 18 espectáculos escénicos y de animación. « Volverá a haber un tren solidario e participará a Fundación ENKI e un camión de bombeiros. A temática invernal, con fadas, animais, bonecos de luz e cor, acróbatas, seres máxicos e demais personaxes fantásticas que acompañarán a Melchor, Gaspar e Baltasar. Ademais, as e os figurantes que participarán este ano irán vestidos cunha indumentaria inspirada no ceo e nas estrelas, unha homenaxe polo 40 aniversario da apertura da Casa das Ciencias e o seu planetario, que se celebrará neste ano 2025 », precisan.

author: @Masrawy
title: عشرات المستوطنين يقتحمون المسجد الأقصى | مصراوى
text:
القدس - (د ب أ)
أفاد تقرير فلسطيني بـ "اقتحام" مستوطنين صباح اليوم الخميس، باحات المسجد الأقصى المبارك في مدينة القدس، بحماية الشرطة الإسرائيلية.
وذكرت وكالة الصحافة الفلسطينية (صفا) أن "عشرات المستوطنين اقتحموا المنطقة الشرقية للمسجد الأقصى على شكل مجموعات، ونفذوا جولات استفزازية في باحاته، وأدوا طقوساً تلمودية".
ووفق الوكالة ، "فرضت شرطة الاحتلال قيودًا مشددة على وصول المصلين الفلسطينيين للأقصى، واحتجزت هويات بعضهم عند بواباته الخارجية".
وأشارت إلى أن الدعوات تتواصل لتكثيف الرباط وشد الرحال إلى المسجد الأقصى.

author: @GilMcGregor_
title: Why did Chris Bosh retire? Revisiting the blood clot issue that ended NBA career at age 31
text:
Chris Bosh's 13-year NBA career was fruitful, but it was cut short by factors outside his control.
The final game of Bosh's NBA career came one month before he celebrated his 32nd birthday. His Hall-of-Fame career was not cut short by injury, but rather by recurring blood clots that forced him into an early retirement.
At the time of his final game, Bosh was redefining himself in his early 30s. He had just earned his 11th consecutive All-Star selection and was averaging 19.1 points per game while canning a career-best 1.5 3-pointers per game.
Despite contractual agreements and a brief comeback attempt, Bosh officially retired from the NBA three years later. Here is how blood clots forced Bosh to step away from the NBA for good.
How blood clots forced Chris Bosh to retire
In February 2015, Bosh was admitted to a hospital for lung tests after complaining about chest discomfort. On Feb. 21, 2015, he was ruled out for the remainder of the 2014-15 NBA season after developing blood clots in one of his lungs.
Bosh was expected to be sidelined for at least six months as the blood-thinning medication used to treat such a condition requires limited physical activity.
He returned to the court on opening night of the 2015-16 NBA season, appearing in each of the Heat's first 53 games before sustaining a calf injury in early February. An 18-point performance against the Spurs on Feb. 9, 2016, would be Bosh's last in the NBA.
During the 2016 NBA All-Star break, doctors discovered another blood clot in Bosh's leg. He was held out of the remainder of the 2015-16 season and the entirety of the 2016 NBA Playoffs.
He failed a physical ahead of training camp for the 2016-17 season and team president Pat Riley said Bosh's career with the Heat "was probably over." Bosh missed the entirety of the 2016-17 season, and in May 2017, he and the Heat agreed that he would leave the team before 2017-18.
The NBA ruled Bosh's blood-clotting as a career-ending illness in June 2017. He was waived by the Heat days later.
In February 2018, Bosh announced he would attempt to make an NBA comeback, but the attempt was short-lived. Bosh formally retired from the NBA when the Heat retired his No. 1 jersey on March 26, 2019.
What are blood clots?
Blood clots are semi-solid or gel-like masses of blood cells that form in a person's blood vessels, per the Cleveland Clinic.
While they help control bleeding, blood clots can cause serious medical issues, including deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism and heart attack.
What is deep vein thrombosis?
Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) occurs when a blood clot forms in a "deep vein," most often occurring in the leg. The condition can cause "pain, warmth and tenderness in the affected area," according to the Mayo Clinic, but the greater concern is the risk of a blood clot traveling to somewhere it would be more dangerous, such as the lungs.
What is a pulmonary embolism?
A pulmonary embolism is a blood clot in your lung that creates a blockage, causing issues with blood flow and oxygen levels in your lungs, per the Cleveland Clinic. This is considered a medical emergency that requires prompt diagnosis and treatment.
A pulmonary embolism occurs when a clot in another part of the body (often leg or arm) moves through your veins to the lung. Pulmonary embolism is the third-most common heart and blood vessel disease in the world.
Chris Bosh career timeline
- Toronto Raptors (2003-2010)
- Miami Heat (2010-16)
The Raptors selected Bosh fourth overall in the 2003 NBA Draft.
Bosh spent the first seven seasons of his career in Toronto. Among Bosh's biggest Raptors highlights is helping the franchise snap a five-year playoff drought in 2007, earning five All-Star selections and the lone All-NBA nod of his career.
As it stands, Bosh is third on Toronto's all-time points list (10,275), first in rebounds (4,776) and blocks (600).
Bosh signed with the Heat in 2010 and was an All-Star each season he played in Miami. He and the Heat made four consecutive NBA Finals appearances from 2010 to 2014, winning titles in 2012 and 2013.
His final game in a Heat uniform was an 18-point performance on Feb. 9, 2016.
Chis Bosh statistics and awards
Career stats
Stat | Total |
Seasons | 13 |
Games | 893 |
Points | 17,189 |
Points per game | 19.2 |
Rebounds | 7.592 |
Rebounds per game | 8.5 |
Assists | 1,795 |
Assists per game | 2.0 |
Blocks | 932 |
Blocks per game | 1.0 |
FG% | 49.4 |
3P% | 33.5 |
FT% | 79.9 |
Career accolades
- Basketball Hall of Famer
- 11-time NBA All-Star
- Two-time NBA champion
- 2008 Olympic gold medalist
- 2007 All-NBA Second Team
- 2004 NBA All-Rookie First Team
- No. 1 retired by Heat
Chris Bosh net worth
Bosh's net worth is $110 million, according to Celebrity Net Worth. The actual figure may be harder to decipher.
Bosh made over $185 million during his playing career. He was waived following the 2016-17 season but was owed $52.1 million for the remainder of his contract, bringing his career earnings closer to $240 million, per Spotrac.
Bosh is also involved in numerous business ventures and investments.

author: Express Web Desk
title: Good Friday across India
text: Mar 29, 2024 Good Friday is a Christian religious holiday observed on the Friday before Easter Sunday. In picture, Devotees take part in the re-enactment of Jesus Christ's Way of the Cross to mark Good Friday in Vadodara. Source: EXPRESS PHOTO BY BHUPENDRA RANA It commemorates the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ at Calvary. In picture, Catholic devotees from Catholic Secular Forum participate in a religious procession enacting the suffering and death of Jesus Christ, in order to mark Good Friday, at Santacruz in Mumbai. Source: Express photo by Sankhadeep Banerjee Christians believe Jesus is the Son of God. In picture, Christian devotees participate in a prayer at the Sacred Heart Cathedral to observe the Good Friday, in New Delhi. Source: Express Photo By Amit Mehra The day is called Good Friday because Jesus was crucified on a Friday. In picture, Christans enact crucifixion of Lord Jesus at Sacred Heart Church in Kolkata. Source: PTI In some regions of India, particularly in states with a significant Christian population like Goa, Kerala, and parts of Northeast India, Good Friday is marked by elaborate church services, reenactments of the Passion of Christ, and the Way of the Cross processions. Source: Express photo by Jithendra M Good Friday is also known as Holy Friday, Black Friday, or Great Friday. In picture, Christian devotees take part in a procession in Jalandhar. Source: PTI It marks the beginning of the Easter weekend and the end of the Holy Week. In picture, a procession in Amritsar. Source: PTI Good Friday is a day of mourning and reflection for Christians worldwide. In picture, an enactment at St Francis D'Sales Cathedral in Nagpur. Source: PTI It is a public holiday in many countries, including the United States, Canada, Australia, and the United Kingdom. In picture, Christian devotees during a play on crucifixion of Jesus Christ in Guwahati. Source: PYI Traditions associated with Good Friday include fasting, attending church services, and participating in processions. In picture, Christian devotees take part in a 'Way of the Cross' procession in Thiruvananthapuram. Source: PTI Some Christians abstain from meat or animal products on this day. In this picture, Christian devotees observe 'Good Friday' at a church, in Chennai. Source: PTI Hot cross buns, sweet bread rolls with a cross on top, are a customary food symbolizing the crucifixion. In picture, Christian devotees at St. Joseph Church, in Hyderabad. Source: PTI Good Friday is a time for Christians to remember Jesus' sacrifice, reflect on selflessness and love, and renew their faith. In picture, a procession in Patna. Source: PTI It is a solemn and meaningful day that emphasizes the importance of Christian principles and values. In picture, a procession in Jammu Source: PTI Countries with easier work visa processes for Indians

author: KL News Network
title: Shopian Freezes at -8.5°C as Cold Wave Grips Kashmir, Jammu, and Ladakh
text:
SRINAGAR: The Kashmir Valley and surrounding regions continue to reel under intense cold, with several locations recording sub-zero temperatures on Friday. Shopian was the coldest spot in the Valley, with the minimum temperature plunging to -8.5°C, followed closely by Larnoo at -8.2°C and Anantnag at -7.7°C. Khudwani, Kulgam, and Pulwama also faced biting cold, recording -7.1°C, -6.8°C, and -6.1°C, respectively.
Representational Image Srinagar, the region’s main city, registered a low of -2.2°C, while Kupwara recorded -1.6°C. Popular tourist destinations like Gulmarg and Pahalgam saw the mercury dip to -4.5°C, while Kokernag and Baramulla recorded -5.5°C and -4.8°C, respectively.
In the Jammu region, temperatures were relatively milder. Jammu city recorded a low of 7.3°C, and Katra experienced a minimum of 11.0°C. However, parts of the region, such as Padder, dipped below freezing at -1.2°C, while Banihal and Bhaderwah recorded 2.0°C and 2.3°C, respectively. Udhampur and Samba experienced lows of 7.3°C and 6.1°C, while Poonch and Kathua recorded 8.1°C and 9.1°C, respectively.
In Ladakh, the winter chill intensified further. Drass was the coldest in the region, with temperatures plummeting to -8.6°C, followed by Kargil at -6.9°C and Leh at -4.4°C.
The data, compiled by Kashmir Weather, underscores the persistent cold wave sweeping across the region, with varying intensities between Kashmir, Jammu, and Ladakh.

author: Sebastien Bell
title: Watch Florida Firefighters Snatch Driver From 18-Wheeler Hanging Off Bridge | Carscoops
text: An 18-wheeler truck ended up with its cab hanging over the edge of a bridge in Palm Beach County, Florida last week. Firefighters used their bucket to approach the semi’s door and rescue the driver who, along with his truck, was hanging in midair. Details on the moments leading up to [the crash ](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/accidents/)haven’t been shared, but reports indicate that it was raining heavily on December 23, the day of the crash. Based on photos of the scene, the truck appears to have plowed head on into a concrete barrier. Fortunately, the obstacle slowed the truck enough to prevent it from falling off an overpass and onto the Florida Turnpike. Unfortunately, most of the cab was [left cantilevering](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/offbeat-news/) over the edge of the bridge, held aloft by the [weight of its trailer](https://www.carscoops.com/2023/12/why-was-this-tesla-model-y-towing-a-10000-lbs-trailer-around-texas/), preventing the driver from escaping. advertisement scroll to continue Read: [Man Walks Away After VW Nosedives 40ft From 4-Story Parking Garage](https://www.carscoops.com/2023/12/man-walks-away-uninjured-after-vw-nosedives-40ft-from-4-story-parking-garage/) PBCFR / Facebook [Palm Beach](https://www.carscoops.com/tag/florida/) County Fire Rescue (PBCFR) reports that after firefighters arrived on the scene, they first worked to brace the truck, and prevent it from falling any farther. They used straps and chains in order to keep the driver and rescue workers safe. Once the cab was shored up, two firefighters entered the bucket of a fire engine, which was raised to the level of the driver door. They harnessed the occupant before guiding him into the bucket with them, and lowering him down to ground level. “He was scared to move,” PBCFR Captain Duane Hodges told [WPBF](https://www.wpbf.com/article/florida-cold-front-rains-palm-beaches-treasure-coast/46235819). “But as I was able to convince him that he needed to come out, he was kind of frozen initially and happy to see us. I don’t think he really wanted to let go of where he was at.” After the rescue, the driver is seen being taken away from the scene in a stretcher. He was taken to a hospital for observation, but was released in time to spend Christmas day with his family. While the incident ended miraculously well for the truck driver, it ended less well for two other drivers, who PBCFR reports crashed near the scene while taking cellphone videos of the incident. Don’t forget to keep your eyes on the road, folks.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Fireworks injuries sent 10,000 people to emergency rooms last year
text:
The Consumer Product Safety Commission estimates fireworks were responsible for at least 1,900 hundred injuries and 11 deaths nationwide last year. With the New Year’s holiday approaching, a Tampa Fire Rescue investigator is offering important safety tips to help residents celebrate the holiday safely and responsibly.
Fireworks accidents led to 10,000 emergency room visits in 2022 “Fireworks are a big deal and a big problem when it comes to an urban environment and shooting fireworks in that environment,” said Tampa Fire Rescue Lt. Frank Rosete. Rosete is the on-call fire investigator assigned to work New Year’s Eve. He said if the past is any indication, he’ll be busy. “I personally go on at least four to five calls related to fireworks,” he said when asked what a typical year looks like in Tampa. Rosete said most of the fires and injuries his department has responded to in the past are preventable.
According to the Consumer Product Safety Commission , more than 10,000 people were treated in emergency rooms for fireworks injuries nationwide last year. Of those, 600 were burned by sparklers. “Adolescents 15 and under are the most injured from the sparklers because they run around. They play sword fights with each other,” Rosete said. “We could have lost him” Other injuries were caused by people re-lighting fireworks that didn’t ignite. “The time you decide to reignite it could be the time it decides to explode,” Rosete said. That happened to a man in Dade City in 2019. “We could have all lost him last night over a firework,” the accident victim’s girlfriend, Ashley Nicholls, said at the time. He was seriously injured after lighting a firework he found on the side of the road. “He lit it, and it blew up in his hand. He blew his thumb off. He broke his finger,” Nicholls said. Rosete said if you plan to launch your own fireworks, have a fire extinguisher or bucket of water close by. And he reminds people that drinking or drugging and explosives aren’t a good combination. “Kind of like a designated driver, have a designated shooter. That he or she is not gonna be under the impairment of an alcoholic beverage,” Rosete said. Leave it to professionals Rosete said it’s always better to leave something as dangerous as fireworks to those who really know what they’re doing. “There is opportunity to go see fireworks at a professional shoot versus you trying to do it at home and run the risk of injuring yourself or others or burning your property down,” he said. Here are some important fireworks safety tips for you to consider if you plan to shoot fireworks this New Year’s Eve. If you have a story you'd like us to investigate, email us at adam@abcactionnews.com

author: Redacción LAVOZ
title: Tormentas en Córdoba: la preocupante advertencia del Servicio Meteorológico sobre las lluvias para 2024
text: [Lluvias por encima de las habituales](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/agro/clima/clima-en-cordoba-estiman-que-seguira-el-calor-que-pasara-con-las-lluvias/) podrían afectar durante este verano el litoral argentino, en tanto que el noroeste del país podría ser afectado por temperaturas mayores a los registros de años anteriores, de acuerdo a lo informado por el [Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN)](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/servicios/video-asi-llego-la-tormenta-a-distintos-sectores-de-cordoba/) en su informe trimestral de enero a marzo de 2024. [Canal especial Clima en Córdoba](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/servicios/alertas-amarilla-y-naranja-por-tormentas-y-vientos-fuertes-para-12-provincias-a-cuales-abarca/) Ese organismo científico del Ministerio de Defensa publicó en su página web el documento según el cual en la región del litoral, [la provincia de Córdoba](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/servicios/clima-en-cordoba-con-jornadas-calurosas-y-poca-lluvia-que-dice-el-pronostico-para-la-ultima-semana-del-2023/), el oeste de Santa Fe y el este de San Luis podrían registrarse precipitaciones superiores a las normales. Además, el reporte advirtió que en las provincias del noroeste argentino podrían registrarse este verano temperaturas por encima de lo norman durante esta época del año, lo que podría favorecer la ocurrencia de olas de calor. La advertencia del SMN por las lluvias en Córdoba en el primer trimestre de 2024 El SMN señaló que “se observan regiones donde las previsiones numéricas experimentales de los principales modelos globales de simulación del clima y modelos estadísticos indican diferencias en cuanto a las probabilidades en el pronóstico estacional; en condiciones neutras [del Fenómeno El Niño ](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/ciudadanos/comenzo-oficialmente-el-fenomeno-de-el-nino-en-argentina-que-es-que-impacto-tiene-en-el-clima-y-cuanto-dura/)Oscilación del Sur (ENOS) y en zonas sin otros forzantes, se espera que el comportamiento responda a la probabilidad del 33.3% en cada categoría”. El texto además indicó que “no se descarta la ocurrencia de eventos de precipitación localmente más intensa que lo normal, especialmente hacia el centro-este, norte y noreste del país. Se recomienda mantenerse actualizado con los pronósticos en la escala diaria y semanal”. El organismo científico también puntualizó que ?no se descarta que hacia el extremo norte, noroeste y centro-oeste del país pueda observarse una mayor frecuencia de temperaturas máximas extremadamente altas pudiendo favorecer eventualmente la ocurrencia de olas de calor?.
